00036     "CREATE TABLE ....... Creates a table",
00037     "DELETE ............. Deletes all or part of a row from a table",
00038     "DESCRIBE TABLE ..... Displays a table's schema",
00039     "DROP TABLE ......... Removes a table",
00040     "ALTER TABLE ........ Add/remove column family from existing table",
00041     "INSERT ............. Inserts data into a table",
00042     "LOAD DATA INFILE ... Loads data from a TSV input file into a table",
00043     "SELECT ............. Selects (and display) cells from a table",
00044     "SHOW CREATE TABLE .. Displays CREATE TABLE command used to create table",
00045     "SHOW TABLES ........ Displays the list of tables",
00046     "SHUTDOWN ........... Shuts servers down gracefully",
00047     "",
00048     "Statements must be terminated with ';'.  For more information on",
00049     "a specific statement, type 'help <statement>', where <statement> is from",
00050     "the preceeding list.",
00051     "",

00075   const char *help_text_create_scanner[] = {
00076     "",
00077     "CREATE SCANNER ON range_spec",
00078     "    [where_clause]",
00079     "    [options_spec]",
00080     "",
00081     "range_spec:",
00082     "    table_name '[' [start_row] \"..\" (end_row | ?? ) ']'",
00083     "",
00084     "where_clause:",
00085     "    WHERE where_predicate [AND where_predicate ...] ",
00086     "",
00087     "where_predicate: ",
00088     "    cell_predicate",
00089     "    | row_predicate",
00090     "    | timestamp_predicate",
00091     "",
00092     "relop: '=' | '<' | '<=' | '>' | '>=' | '=^'",
00093     "",
00094     "cell_spec: row_key ',' qualified_column",
00095     "",
00096     "cell_predicate: ",
00097     "    [cell_spec relop] CELL relop cell_spec",
00098     "    | '(' [cell_spec relop] CELL relop cell_spec",
00099     "          (OR [cell_spec relop] CELL relop cell_spec)* ')'",
00100     "",
00101     "row_predicate: ",
00102     "    [row_key relop] ROW relop row_key",
00103     "    | '(' [row_key relop] ROW relop row_key",
00104     "          (OR [row_key relop] ROW relop row_key)* ')'",
00105     "",
00106     "timestamp_predicate: ",
00107     "    [timestamp relop] TIMESTAMP relop timestamp",
00108     "",
00109     "options_spec:",
00110     "    (REVS = revision_count",
00111     "    | LIMIT = row_count",
00112     "    | INTO FILE 'file_name'",
00113     "    | DISPLAY_TIMESTAMPS",
00114     "    | RETURN_DELETES",
00115     "    | KEYS_ONLY)*",
00116     "",
00117     "timestamp:",
00118     "    'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.nanoseconds]'",
00119     "",
00120     "NOTES:  If the start_row is absent from a range_spec, it means NULL or",
00121     "the beginning of the range.  If the end_row is specified as ??, then it",
00122     "will get converted to 0xff 0xff which indicates the end of the range.",
00123     "",
00124     "Example:",
00125     "",
00126     "  CREATE SCANNER ON Test[..??]",
00127     "",
00128     0
00129   };

00171     "",
00172     "This command will read blocks of key/value pairs from input_file",
00173     "and send them to the range server.  Here are some example input file",
00174     "lines that illustrate the format of this file:",
00175     "",
00176     "1189631331826108        acaleph DELETE",
00177     "1189631331826202        acrostolion     apple:http://www.baseball.com/       Vilia miretur vulgus",
00178     "1189631331826211        acerin  banana:http://sports.espn.go.com/       DELETE",

00180     "The fields are separated by the tab character, with the following format:",
00181     ""
00182     "<timestamp> '\\t' <row-key> '\\t' <column-family>[:<column-qualfier>] '\\t' <value>",
00183     "",
00184     "The string \"DELETE\" has special meaning.  In the first example line",

00186     "third example line above, it generates a 'delete cell' for the column",
00187     "'banana:http://sports.espn.go.com/' of row 'acerin'.",

00216   const char *help_text_alter_table[] = {
00217     "",
00218     "ALTER TABLE",
00219     "===========",
00220     "",
00221     "    ALTER TABLE name alter_mode '(' [alter_definition] ')' ",
00222     "        [alter_mode '(' alter_definition ')' ... ]",
00223     "",
00224     "    alter_mode:",
00225     "      ADD",
00226     "      | DROP",
00227     "",
00228     "    alter_definition:",
00229     "      add_cf_definition",
00230     "      | drop_cf_definition",
00231     "",
00232     "    drop_cf_definition:    column_family_name ",
00233     "",
00234     "    add_cf_definition:",
00235     "      column_family_name [MAX_VERSIONS '=' int] [TTL '=' duration]",
00236     "      | ACCESS GROUP name [access_group_option ...]",
00237     "        ['(' [column_family_name, ...] ')']",
00238     "",
00239     "    duration:",
00240     "      num MONTHS",
00241     "      | num WEEKS",
00242     "      | num DAYS",
00243     "      | num HOURS",
00244     "      | num MINUTES",
00245     "      | num [ SECONDS ]",
00246     "",
00247     "    access_group_option:",
00248     "      IN_MEMORY",
00249     "      | BLOCKSIZE '=' int",
00250     "      | COMPRESSOR '=' compressor_spec",
00251     "      | BLOOMFILTER '=' bloom_filter_spec",
00252     "",
00253     "    compressor_spec:",
00254     "      bmz [ bmz_options ]",
00255     "      | lzo",
00256     "      | quicklz",
00257     "      | zlib [ zlib_options ]",
00258     "      | none",
00259     "",
00260     "    bmz_options:",
00261     "      --fp-len int",
00262     "      | --offset int",
00263     "",
00264     "    zlib_options:",
00265     "      -9",
00266     "      | --best",
00267     "      | --normal",
00268     "",
00269     "    bloom_filter_spec:",
00270     "      rows [ bloom_filter_options ]",
00271     "      | rows+cols [ bloom_filter_options ]",
00272     "      | none ",
00273     "",
00274     "    bloom_filter_options:",
00275     "      --false-positive float",
00276     "      --max-approx-items int",
00277     "",
00278     "Description",
00279     "-----------",
00280     "",
00281     "The `ALTER TABLE` command provides a way to alter a table by adding access",
00282     "groups and column families and/or removing column families.  See",
00283     "[`CREATE TABLE`](create-table.html) for a description of the column family",
00284     "and access group options.  Column families that are not explicitly",
00285     "included in an access group specification will go into the \"default\"",
00286     "access group.",
00287     "",
00288     "Example",
00289     "-------",
00290     "",
00291     "The following statements:",
00292     "",
00293     "    CREATE TABLE foo (",
00294     "      a MAX_VERSIONS=1,",
00295     "      b TTL=1 DAY,",
00296     "      c,",
00297     "      ACCESS GROUP primary BLOCKSIZE=1024 ( a ),",
00298     "      ACCESS GROUP secondary compressor=\"zlib --best\" ( b, c )",
00299     "    );",
00300     "",
00301     "    ALTER TABLE foo ",
00302     "      ADD ( d MAX_VERSIONS=2 ) ",
00303     "      ADD ( ACCESS GROUP tertiary BLOOMFILTER=\"rows --false-positive 0.1\" (d))",
00304     "      DROP ( c );",
00305     "",
00306     "will produce a table with the following `SHOW CREATE TABLE` output ...",
00307     "",
00308     "    CREATE TABLE foo (",
00309     "      a MAX_VERSIONS=1,",
00310     "      b TTL=86400,",
00311     "      d MAX_VERSIONS=2,",
00312     "      ACCESS GROUP primary BLOCKSIZE=1024 (a),",
00313     "      ACCESS GROUP secondary COMPRESSOR=\"zlib --best\" (b),",
00314     "      ACCESS GROUP tertiary BLOOMFILTER=\"rows --false-positive 0.1\" (d),",
00315     "    )",
00316     0
00317   };

00352   const char *help_text_create_table[] = {
00353     "CREATE TABLE",
00354     "============",
00355     "",
00356     "    CREATE TABLE [table_option ...] name '(' [create_definition, ...] ')'",
00357     "    CREATE TABLE name LIKE example_name",
00358     "",
00359     "    table_option:",
00360     "      MAX_VERSIONS '=' int",
00361     "      | TTL '=' duration",
00362     "      | IN_MEMORY",
00363     "      | BLOCKSIZE '=' int",
00364     "      | COMPRESSOR '=' compressor_spec",
00365     "",
00366     "    create_definition:",
00367     "      column_family_name [MAX_VERSIONS '=' int] [TTL '=' duration]",
00368     "      | ACCESS GROUP name [access_group_option ...]",
00369     "        ['(' [column_family_name, ...] ')']",
00370     "",
00371     "    duration:",
00372     "      int MONTHS",
00373     "      | int WEEKS",
00374     "      | int DAYS",
00375     "      | int HOURS",
00376     "      | int MINUTES",
00377     "      | int [ SECONDS ]",
00378     "",
00379     "    access_group_option:",
00380     "      IN_MEMORY",
00381     "      | BLOCKSIZE '=' int",
00382     "      | COMPRESSOR '=' compressor_spec",
00383     "      | BLOOMFILTER '=' bloom_filter_spec",
00384     "",
00385     "    compressor_spec:",
00386     "      bmz [ bmz_options ]",
00387     "      | lzo",
00388     "      | quicklz",
00389     "      | zlib [ zlib_options ]",
00390     "      | none",
00391     "",
00392     "    bmz_options:",
00393     "      --fp-len int",
00394     "      | --offset int",
00395     "",
00396     "    zlib_options:",
00397     "      -9",
00398     "      | --best",
00399     "      | --normal",
00400     "",
00401     "    bloom_filter_spec:",
00402     "      rows [ bloom_filter_options ]",
00403     "      | rows+cols [ bloom_filter_options ]",
00404     "      | none ",
00405     "",
00406     "    bloom_filter_options:",
00407     "      --false-positive float",
00408     "      --max-approx-items int",
00409     "",
00410     "Description",
00411     "-----------",
00412     "",
00413     "CREATE TABLE creates a table with the given name.  A table consists of a set",
00414     "of column family and access group specifications.",
00415     "",
00416     "Column Families",
00417     "---------------",
00418     "",
00419     "Column families are somewhat analogous to a traditional database column.  The",
00420     "main difference is that a theoretically infinite number of qualified columns",
00421     "can be created within a column family.  The qualifier is an optional NUL-",
00422     "terminated string that can be supplied, along with the data, in the insert",
00423     "statement.  This is what gives tables in Hypertable their sparse nature.  For",
00424     "example, given a column family \"tag\", the following set of qualified columns",
00425     "may be inserted for a single row.",
00426     "",
00427     " * tag:good",
00428     " * tag:science",
00429     " * tag:authoritative",
00430     " * tag:green",
00431     "",
00432     "The column family is represented internally as a single byte, so there is a",
00433     "limit of 255 column families (the 0 value is reserved) which may be supplied in",
00434     "the CREATE TABLE statement.",
00435     "",
00436     "Access Groups",
00437     "-------------",
00438     "",
00439     "Tables consist of one or more access groups, each containing some number of",
00440     "column families.  There is a default access group named \"default\" which",
00441     "contains all column families that are not explicitly referenced in an ACCESS",
00442     "GROUP clause.  For example, the following two statements are equivalent.",
00443     "",
00444     "    CREATE TABLE foo (",
00445     "      a,",
00446     "      b,",
00447     "      c,",
00448     "      ACCESS GROUP bar ( a, b ) ",
00449     "    )",
00450     "",
00451     "    CREATE TABLE foo (",
00452     "      a,",
00453     "      b,",
00454     "      c,",
00455     "      ACCESS GROUP bar (a, b),",
00456     "      ACCESS GROUP default (c) ",
00457     "    )",
00458     "",
00459     "Access groups provide control over the physical layout of the table data on",
00460     "disk.  The data for all column families in the same access group are stored",
00461     "physically together on disk.  By carefully defining a set of access groups and",
00462     "choosing which column families go into those access groups, performance can be",
00463     "significantly improved for expected workloads.  For example, say you have a",
00464     "table with 100 column families, but two of the column families get access",
00465     "together with much higher frequency than the rest of the 98 column families.",
00466     "By putting the two frequently accessed column families in their own access",
00467     "group, the system does much less disk i/o because only the data for the two",
00468     "column families gets transfered whenever those column families are accessed.  A",
00469     "row-oriented database can be emulated by having a single access group.  A",
00470     "column-oriented database can be emulated by having each column family within",
00471     "their own access group.",
00472     "",
00473     "Table Options",
00474     "-------------",
00475     "",
00476     "The following table options are supported:",
00477     "",
00478     "  * MAX_VERSIONS '=' int",
00479     "  * TTL '=' duration",
00480     "  * IN_MEMORY",
00481     "  * BLOCKSIZE '=' int",
00482     "  * COMPRESSOR '=' compressor_spec",
00483     "",
00484     "These are the same options as the ones in the column family and access group",
00485     "specification except that they act as defaults in the case where no",
00486     "corresponding option is specified in the column family or access group",
00487     "specifier.  See the description under Access Group Options for option details.",
00488     "",
00489     "Column Family Options",
00490     "---------------------",
00491     "",
00492     "The following column family options are supported:",
00493     "",
00494     "  * MAX_VERSIONS '=' int",
00495     "  * TTL '=' duration",
00496     "",
00497     "Cells in a table are specified by not only a row key and a qualified column,",
00498     "but also a timestamp.  This allows for essentially multiple timestamped version",
00499     "s of each cell.  Cells are kept stored in reverse chronological order of",
00500     "timestamp and the MAX_VERSIONS allows you to specify that you only want to",
00501     "keep the n most recent versions of each cell.  Older versions are lazily",
00502     "garbage collected through the normal compaction process.",
00503     "",
00504     "The TTL option allows you to specify that you only want to keep cell versions",
00505     "that fall within some time window in the immediate past.  For example, you can",
00506     "specify that you only want to keep cells that were created within the past two",
00507     "weeks.  Like the MAX_VERSIONS option, older versions are lazily garbage",
00508     "collected through the normal compaction process.",
00509     "",
00510     "Access Group Options",
00511     "--------------------",
00512     "",
00513     "The following access group options are supported:",
00514     "",
00515     "  * IN_MEMORY",
00516     "  * BLOCKSIZE '=' int",
00517     "  * COMPRESSOR '=' compressor_spec",
00518     "  * BLOOMFILTER '=' bloom_filter_spec",
00519     "",
00520     "The IN_MEMORY option indicates that all cell data for the access group should",
00521     "remain memory resident.  Queries against column families in IN_MEMORY access",
00522     "groups are efficient because no disk access is required.",
00523     "",
00524     "The cell data inserted into an access group resides in one of two places.  The",
00525     "recently inserted cells are stored in an in-memory data structure called the",
00526     "cell cache and older cells get compacted into on-disk data structures called",
00527     "cell stores.  The cell stores are organized as a series of compressed blocks of",
00528     "sorted key/value pairs (cells).  At the end of the compressed blocks is a block",
00529     "index which contains, for each block, the key (row,column,timestamp) of the",
00530     "last cell in the block, followed by the block offset.  It also contains a Bloom",
00531     "Filter.",
00532     "",
00533     "The BLOCKSIZE option controls the size of the compressed blocks in the cell",
00534     "stores.  A smaller block size minimizes the amount of data that must be read",
00535     "from disk and decompressed for a key lookup at the expense of a larger block",
00536     "index which consumes memory.  The default value for the block size is 65K.",
00537     "",
00538     "The COMPRESSOR option specifies the compression codec that should be used for",
00539     "cell store blocks within an access group.  See the Compressors section below",
00540     "for a description of each compression codec.",
00541     "",
00542     "NOTE: if the block, after compression, is not significantly reduced in",
00543     "size, then no compression will be performed on the block",
00544     "",
00545     "An access group can consist of many on-disk cell stores.  A query for a single",
00546     "row key can result probing each cell store to see if data is present for that",
00547     "row even when most of the cell stores do not contain any data for that row.",
00548     "To eliminate this inefficiency, each cell store contains an optional Bloom",
00549     "Filter.  The Bloom Filter is a probabilistic data structure that can",
00550     "indicate, with high probability, if a key is present and also indicate",
00551     "definitively if a key is not present.  By mapping the bloom filters, for each",
00552     "cell store in memory, queries can be made much more efficient because only the",
00553     "cell stores that contain the row are searched.",
00554     "",
00555     "The bloom filter specification can take one of the following forms.  The rows",
00556     "form, which is the default, causes only row keys to be inserted into the bloom",
00557     "filter.  The rows+cols form causes the row key concatenated with the column",
00558     "family to be inserted into the bloom filter.  none disables the bloom",
00559     "filter.",
00560     "",
00561     "  * rows [ bloom_filter_options ]",
00562     "  * rows+cols [ bloom_filter_options ]",
00563     "  * none",
00564     "",
00565     "The following describes the bloom filter options:",
00566     "",
00567     "  --false-positive arg    Expected false positive probability (default = 0.01)",
00568     "  --max-approx-items arg  Number of cell store items used to guess the number",
00569     "                          of actual bloom filter entries (default = 1000)",
00570     "",
00571     "Compressors",
00572     "-----------",
00573     "",
00574     "The cell store blocks within an access group are compressed using the",
00575     "compression codec that is specified for the access group.  The following",
00576     "compression codecs are available:",
00577     "",
00578     "  * bmz",
00579     "  * lzo",
00580     "  * quicklz",
00581     "  * zlib",
00582     "  * none",
00583     "",
00584     "The default code is lzo for cell store blocks.  The following list describes",
00585     "some of the available options.",
00586     "",
00587     "  bmz --fp-len arg    Minimum fingerpring length (default = 19)",
00588     "  bmz --offset arg    Starting fingerprint offset (default = 0)",
00589     "  zlib -9 [ --best ]  Highest compression ratio (at the cost of speed)",
00590     "  zlib --normal       Normal compression ratio",
00591     "",
00592     0
00593   };
00594 
00595   const char *help_text_select[] = {
00596     "",
00597     "SELECT",
00598     "======",
00599     "",
00600     "    SELECT ('*' | column_family_name [',' column_family_name]*)",
00601     "      FROM table_name",
00602     "      [where_clause]",
00603     "      [options_spec]",
00604     "",
00605     "    where_clause:",
00606     "        WHERE where_predicate [AND where_predicate ...]",
00607     "",
00608     "    where_predicate:",
00609     "      cell_predicate",
00610     "      | row_predicate",
00611     "      | timestamp_predicate",
00612     "",
00613     "    relop: '=' | '<' | '<=' | '>' | '>=' | '=^'",
00614     "",
00615     "    cell_spec: row_key ',' qualified_column",
00616     "",
00617     "    cell_predicate:",
00618     "      [cell_spec relop] CELL relop cell_spec",
00619     "      | '(' [cell_spec relop] CELL relop cell_spec",
00620     "            (OR [cell_spec relop] CELL relop cell_spec)* ')'",
00621     "",
00622     "    row_predicate: ",
00623     "      [row_key relop] ROW relop row_key",
00624     "      | '(' [row_key relop] ROW relop row_key",
00625     "              (OR [row_key relop] ROW relop row_key)* ')'",
00626     "",
00627     "    timestamp_predicate: ",
00628     "      [timestamp relop] TIMESTAMP relop timestamp",
00629     "",
00630     "    options_spec:",
00631     "      (REVS = revision_count",
00632     "      | LIMIT = row_count",
00633     "      | INTO FILE 'file_name'",
00634     "      | DISPLAY_TIMESTAMPS",
00635     "      | RETURN_DELETES",
00636     "      | KEYS_ONLY",
00637     "      | NOESCAPE)*",
00638     "",
00639     "    timestamp:",
00640     "      'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.nanoseconds]'",
00641     "",
00642     "Description",
00643     "-----------",
00644     "",
00645     "The parser only accepts a single timestamp predicate.  The '=^' operator is the",
00646     "\"starts with\" operator.  It will return all rows that have the same prefix as",
00647     "the operand.",
00648     "",
00649     "Examples",
00650     "--------",
00651     "",
00652     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE ('a' <= ROW <= 'e') and",
00653     "                             '2008-07-28 00:00:02' < TIMESTAMP < '2008-07-28 00:00:07';",
00654     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE ROW =^ 'b';",
00655     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE (ROW = 'a' or ROW = 'c' or ROW = 'g');",
00656     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE ('a' < ROW <= 'c' or ROW = 'g' or ROW = 'c');",
00657     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE (ROW < 'c' or ROW > 'd');",
00658     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE (ROW < 'b' or ROW =^ 'b');",
00659     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE \"farm\",\"tag:abaca\" < CELL <= \"had\",\"tag:abacinate\";",
00660     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE \"farm\",\"tag:abaca\" <= CELL <= \"had\",\"tag:abacinate\";",
00661     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE CELL = \"foo\",\"tag:adactylism\";",
00662     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE CELL =^ \"foo\",\"tag:ac\";",
00663     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE CELL =^ \"foo\",\"tag:a\";",
00664     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE CELL > \"old\",\"tag:abacate\";",
00665     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE CELL >= \"old\",\"tag:abacate\";",
00666     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE \"old\",\"tag:foo\" < CELL >= \"old\",\"tag:abacate\";",
00667     "    SELECT * FROM test WHERE ( CELL = \"maui\",\"tag:abaisance\" OR ",
00668     "                               CELL = \"foo\",\"tag:adage\" OR ",
00669     "                               CELL = \"cow\",\"tag:Ab\" OR ",
00670     "                               CELL =^ \"foo\",\"tag:acya\");",
00671     "",
00672     0
00673   };
00674 
00675   const char *help_text_describe_table[] = {
00676     "",
00677     "DESCRIBE TABLE",
00678     "==============",
00679     "",
00680     "    DESCRIBE TABLE [ WITH IDS ] table_name",
00681     "",
00682     "Description",
00683     "-----------",
00684     "",
00685     "The DESCRIBE TABLE command displays the XML-style schema for a table.  The",
00686     "output of the straight DESCRIBE TABLE command can be passed into the",
00687     "Hypertable C++ Client::create_table() API as the schema parameter.  If the",
00688     "optional WITH IDS clause is supplied, then the schema \"generation\" attribute",
00689     "and the column family \"id\" attributes are included in the XML output.  For",
00690     "example, the following table creation statement:",
00691     "",
00692     "    CREATE TABLE foo (",
00693     "      a MAX_VERSIONS=1,",
00694     "      b TTL=1 DAY,",
00695     "      c,",
00696     "      ACCESS GROUP primary BLOCKSIZE=1024 ( a, b ),",
00697     "      ACCESS GROUP secondary compressor=\"zlib --best\" ( c )",
00698     "    )",
00699     "",
00700     "will create a table with the following schema as reported by the CREATE TABLE",
00701     "command:",
00702     "",
00703     "    <Schema>",
00704     "      <AccessGroup name=\"primary\" blksz=\"1024\">",
00705     "        <ColumnFamily>",
00706     "          <Name>a</Name>",
00707     "          <MaxVersions>1</MaxVersions>",
00708     "          <deleted>false</deleted>",
00709     "        </ColumnFamily>",
00710     "        <ColumnFamily>",
00711     "          <Name>b</Name>",
00712     "          <ttl>86400</ttl>",
00713     "          <deleted>false</deleted>",
00714     "        </ColumnFamily>",
00715     "      </AccessGroup>",
00716     "      <AccessGroup name=\"secondary\" compressor=\"zlib --best\">",
00717     "        <ColumnFamily>",
00718     "          <Name>c</Name>",
00719     "          <deleted>false</deleted>",
00720     "        </ColumnFamily>",
00721     "      </AccessGroup>",
00722     "    </Schema>",
00723     "",
00724     "and the following output will be generated when the WITH IDS clause is",
00725     "supplied in the CREATE TABLE statement:",
00726     "",
00727     "    <Schema generation=\"1\">",
00728     "      <AccessGroup name=\"primary\" blksz=\"1024\">",
00729     "        <ColumnFamily id=\"1\">",
00730     "          <Generation>1</Generation>",
00731     "          <Name>a</Name>",
00732     "          <MaxVersions>1</MaxVersions>",
00733     "          <deleted>false</deleted>",
00734     "        </ColumnFamily>",
00735     "        <ColumnFamily id=\"2\">",
00736     "          <Generation>1</Generation>",
00737     "          <Name>b</Name>",
00738     "          <ttl>86400</ttl>",
00739     "          <deleted>false</deleted>",
00740     "        </ColumnFamily>",
00741     "      </AccessGroup>",
00742     "      <AccessGroup name=\"secondary\" compressor=\"zlib --best\">",
00743     "        <ColumnFamily id=\"3\">",
00744     "          <Generation>1</Generation>",
00745     "          <Name>c</Name>",
00746     "          <deleted>false</deleted>",
00747     "        </ColumnFamily>",
00748     "      </AccessGroup>",
00749     "    </Schema>",
00750     "",
00751     0
00752   };

00776   const char *help_text_load_data_infile[] = {
00777     "",
00778     "LOAD DATA INFILE",
00779     "================",
00780     "",
00781     "    LOAD DATA INFILE [options] fname INTO TABLE name",
00782     "",
00783     "    LOAD DATA INFILE [options] fname INTO FILE fname",
00784     "",
00785     "    options:",
00786     "",
00787     "      (ROW_KEY_COLUMN '=' column_specifier ['+' column_specifier ...]",
00788     "       | TIMESTAMP_COLUMN '=' name |",
00789     "       | HEADER_FILE '=' '\"' filename '\"'",
00790     "       | ROW_UNIQUIFY_CHARS '=' n",
00791     "       | NOESCAPE)*",
00792     "",
00793     "    column_specifier =",
00794     "      [ column_format ] column_name",
00795     "",
00796     "    column_format",
00797     "      \"%0\" int",
00798     "      | \"%-\"",
00799     "      | \"%\"",
00800     "",
00801     "Description",
00802     "-----------",
00803     "",
00804     "The LOAD DATA INFILE command provides a way to bulk load data from an",
00805     "optionally compressed file or stdin (fname of \"-\"), into a table.  The input",
00806     "is assumed to start with a header line that indicates the format of the lines",
00807     "in the file.  The header can optionlly be stored in a separate file and",
00808     "referenced with the HEADER_FILE option.  The header is expected to have the",
00809     "following format:",
00810     "",
00811     "    header = ",
00812     "      single_cell_format ",
00813     "      | multi_cell_format",
00814     "",
00815     "    single_cell_format =",
00816     "      \"row\" '\\t' \"column\" '\\t' \"value\" '\\n'",
00817     "      | \"timestamp\" '\\t' \"row\" '\\t' \"column\" '\\t' \"value\" '\\n'",
00818     "",
00819     "    multi_cell_format =",
00820     "      column | string ( '\\t' ( column | string ) )*",
00821     "",
00822     "    column = column_family [ ':' column_qualifier ]",
00823     "",
00824     "Two basic tab-delimited formats are supported, a single cell format in which",
00825     "each line contains a single cell, and a multi-cell format in which each line",
00826     "can contain a list of cells.  The following example shows the single-cell",
00827     "format:",
00828     "",
00829     "= Example 1 =",
00830     "",
00831     "    row     column  value",
00832     "    1127071 query   guardianship",
00833     "    1127071 item:rank       8",
00834     "    1127071 click_url       http://adopting.adoption.com",
00835     "    1246036 query   polish american priests association",
00836     "    1246036 item:rank       6",
00837     "    1246036 click_url       http://www.palichicago.org",
00838     "    12653   query   lowes",
00839     "    12653   item:rank       1",
00840     "    12653   click_url       http://www.lowes.com",
00841     "    1270972 query   head hunters",
00842     "    1270972 item:rank       2",
00843     "    1270972 click_url       http://www.headhunters.com",
00844     "    2648672 query   jamie farr",
00845     "    2648672 item:rank       1",
00846     "    2648672 click_url       http://www.imdb.com",
00847     "    ...",
00848     "",
00849     "An optional initial timestamp column can be included which represents the cell",
00850     "timestamp, for example:",
00851     "",
00852     "= Example 2 =",
00853     "",
00854     "    timestamp       row     column  value",
00855     "    2009-08-12 00:01:08     1127071 query   guardianship",
00856     "    2009-08-12 00:01:08     1127071 item:rank       8",
00857     "    2009-08-12 00:01:08     1127071 click_url       http://adopting.adoption.com",
00858     "    2009-08-12 00:01:18     1246036 query   polish american priests association",
00859     "    2009-08-12 00:01:18     1246036 item:rank       6",
00860     "    2009-08-12 00:01:18     1246036 click_url       http://www.palichicago.org",
00861     "    2009-08-12 00:01:14     12653   query   lowes",
00862     "    2009-08-12 00:01:14     12653   item:rank       1",
00863     "    2009-08-12 00:01:14     12653   click_url       http://www.lowes.com",
00864     "    2009-08-12 00:01:10     1270972 query   head hunters",
00865     "    2009-08-12 00:01:10     1270972 item:rank       2",
00866     "    2009-08-12 00:01:10     1270972 click_url       http://www.headhunters.com",
00867     "    2009-08-12 00:01:17     2648672 query   jamie farr",
00868     "    2009-08-12 00:01:17     2648672 item:rank       1",
00869     "    2009-08-12 00:01:17     2648672 click_url       http://www.imdb.com",
00870     "    ...",
00871     "",
00872     "The multi-line format assumes that each tab delimited field represents a cell",
00873     "value and the column header specifies the name of the column.  Unless otherwise",
00874     "specified, the first column is assumed to be the rowkey.  For example:",
00875     "",
00876     "= Example 3 =",
00877     "",
00878     "    anon_id            query           item:rank   click_url",
00879     "    3613173            batman signal images        18      http://www.icomania.com",
00880     "    1127071            guardianship  8             http://adopting.adoption.com",
00881     "    1270972            head hunters  2             http://www.headhunters.com",
00882     "    465778     google        1             http://www.google.com",
00883     "    12653      lowes         1             http://www.lowes.com",
00884     "    48785      address locator             2       http://www.usps.com/ncsc/",
00885     "    48785      address locator             3       http://factfinder.census.gov",
00886     "    2648672            jamie farr                  1       http://www.imdb.com",
00887     "    1246036            polish american     6       http://www.palichicago.org",
00888     "    605089     dachshunds for sale 2       http://www.houstonzone.org",
00889     "    760038     stds       1   http://www.ashastd.org",
00890     "",
00891     "When loaded into a table with a straight LOAD DATA INFILE command, the above",
00892     "file will produce a set of cells equivalent to Example 1 above.",
00893     "",
00894     "Options",
00895     "-------",
00896     "",
00897     "ROW_KEY_COLUMN = column_specifier [ + column_specifier ... ]",
00898     "",
00899     "The LOAD DATA INFILE command accepts a number of options.  The first is the",
00900     "ROW_KEY_COLUMN option.  This is used in conjunction with the multi-cell",
00901     "input file format.  It provides a way to select which column in the input",
00902     "file should be used as the row key.  By separating two or more column names",
00903     "with the '+' character, multiple column values will be concatenated together,",
00904     "separated by a single space character to form the row key.  Also, each",
00905     "column specifier can have one of the following prefixes to control field width",
00906     "and justification:",
00907     "",
00908     "%0<n>  For numeric columns, specifies a field width of &lt;n&gt;",
00909     "       and right-justify with '0' padding",
00910     "",
00911     "%-<n>  Specifies a field width of &lt;n&gt; and right-justification",
00912     "       with ' ' (space) padding",
00913     "",
00914     "%<n>   Specifies a field width of &lt;n&gt; and left-justification",
00915     "       with ' ' (space) padding",
00916     "",
00917     "",
00918     "For example, assuming the data in Example 3 above is contained in a filed",
00919     "named \"query-log.tsv\", then the following LOAD DATA INFILE command:",
00920     "",
00921     "    LOAD DATA INFILE ROW_KEY_COLUMN=\"%09anon_id\"+query \"query-log.tsv\" INTO TABLE 'anon-id-query';",
00922     "",
00923     "will populated the 'anon-id-query' table with the following content:",
00924     "",
00925     "    000012653 lowes             item:rank          1",
00926     "    000012653 lowes             click_url          http://www.lowes.com",
00927     "    000048785 address locator              item:rank       3",
00928     "    000048785 address locator              item:rank       2",
00929     "    000048785 address locator              click_url       http://factfinder.census.gov",
00930     "    000048785 address locator              click_url       http://www.usps.com/ncsc/",
00931     "    000465778 google  item:rank            1",
00932     "    000465778 google  click_url            http://www.google.com",
00933     "    000605089 dachshunds for sale          item:rank       2",
00934     "    000605089 dachshunds for sale          click_url       http://www.houstonzone.org",
00935     "    000760038 stds      item:rank          1",
00936     "    000760038 stds      click_url          http://www.ashastd.org",
00937     "    001127071 guardianship                 item:rank       8",
00938     "    001127071 guardianship                 click_url       http://adopting.adoption.com",
00939     "    001246036 polish american              item:rank       6",
00940     "    001246036 polish american              click_url       http://www.palichicago.org",
00941     "    001270972 head hunters                 item:rank       2",
00942     "    001270972 head hunters                 click_url       http://www.headhunters.com",
00943     "    002648672 jamie farr                   item:rank       1",
00944     "    002648672 jamie farr                   click_url       http://www.imdb.com",
00945     "    003613173 batman signal images         item:rank       18",
00946     "    003613173 batman signal images         click_url       http://www.icomania.com",
00947     "",
00948     "TIMESTAMP_COLUMN = column_name",
00949     "",
00950     "The TIMESTAMP_COLUMN option is used in conjunction with the multi-cell input",
00951     "file format to specify which field of the input file should be used as the",
00952     "timestamp.  The timestamp extracted from this field will be used for each cell",
00953     "in the row.  The timestamp field is assumed to have the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS",
00954     "",
00955     "HEADER_FILE = \"filename\"",
00956     "",
00957     "The HEADER_FILE option is used to specify an alternate file that contains",
00958     "the header line for the data file.  This is useful in situations where you have",
00959     "log files that roll periodically and/or you want to be able to concatenate",
00960     "them.  This option allows the input files to just contain data and the header",
00961     "to be specified in a separate file.",
00962     "",
00963     "ROW_UNIQUIFY_CHARS = n",
00964     "",
00965     "The ROW_UNIQUIFY_CHARS option provides a way to append a random string of",
00966     "characters to the end of the row keys to ensure that they are unique.  The",
00967     "maximum number of characters you can specify is 21 and each character",
00968     "represents 6 random bits.  It is useful in situations where the row key isn't",
00969     "discriminating enough to cause each input line to wind up in its own row.",
00970     "For example, let's say you want to dump a server log into a table, using the",
00971     "timestamp as the row key.  However, as in the case of an Apache log, the",
00972     "timestamp usually only has resolution down to the second and there may be",
00973     "many entries that fall within the same second.",
00974     "",
00975     "NOESCAPE",
00976     "",
00977     "The NOESCAPE option provides a way to disable the escaping mechanism.  The",
00978     "newline and tab characters are escaped and unescaped when transferred in",
00979     "and out of the system.  The LOAD DATA INFILE command will scan the input",
00980     "for the two character sequence '\' 'n' and will convert it into a newline",
00981     "character.  It will also scan the input for the two character sequence",
00982     "'\' 't' and will convert it into a tab character.  The NOESCAPE option",
00983     "disables this conversion.",
00984     "",
00985     "Compression",
00986     "-----------",
00987     "",
00988     "If the name of the input file ends with a \".gz\", the file is assumed to be",
00989     "compressed and will be streamed in through a decompressor (gzip).",
00990     "",
00991     0
00992   };
00993 
00994   const char *help_text_insert[] = {
00995     "",
00996     "INSERT",
00997     "======",
00998     "",
00999     "    INSERT INTO table_name VALUES value_list",
01000     "    ",
01001     "    value_list:",
01002     "        value_spec [',' value_spec ...]",
01003     "    ",
01004     "    value_spec:",
01005     "        '(' row ',' column ',' value ')'",
01006     "        '(' timestamp ',' row ',' column ',' value ')'",
01007     "",
01008     "    column:",
01009     "        family [ ':' qualifier ]",
01010     "    ",
01011     "    timestamp:",
01012     "        YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.nanoseconds]",
01013     "",
01014     "Description",
01015     "-----------",
01016     "",
01017     "The INSERT command inserts data (cells) into a table.  The data is supplied",
01018     "as a list of comma separated tuples.  Each tuple represents a cell and can take",
01019     "one of two forms:",
01020     "",
01021     "  * (row, column, value)",
01022     "  * (timestamp, row, column, value)",
01023     "",
01024     "The first form just supplies the row key, column key, and value as strings and",
01025     "the cell timestamp is auto-assigned.  The second form supplies the timestamp in",
01026     "addition to the row key, column key, and value.  For example, the following",
01027     "INSERT statement:",
01028     "",
01029     "    INSERT INTO fruit VALUES (\"cantelope\", \"tag:good\", \"Had with breakfast\"),",
01030     "    (\"2009-08-02 08:30:00\", \"cantelope\", \"description\", \"A cultivated variety",
01031     "    of muskmelon with orange flesh\"),(\"banana\", \"tag:great\", \"Had with lunch\");",
01032     "",
01033     "might yield the following output from the SELECT command:",
01034     "",
01035     "    SELECT * FROM fruit DISPLAY_TIMESTAMPS;",
01036     "    2009-08-11 05:06:17.246062001  banana     tag:great    Had with lunch",
01037     "    2009-08-11 05:06:17.246062002  cantelope  tag:good     Had with breakfast",
01038     "    2009-08-02 08:30:00.000000000  cantelope  description  A cultivated variety",
01039     "    of muskmelon with orange flesh",
01040     "",
01041     0
01042   };
01043 
01044   const char *help_text_delete[] = {
01045     "",
01046     "DELETE",
01047     "======",
01048     "",
01049     "    DELETE ('*' | column [',' column ...])",
01050     "      FROM table_name",
01051     "      WHERE ROW '=' row_key",
01052     "      [TIMESTAMP timestamp]",
01053     "",
01054     "    column:",
01055     "      column_family [':' column_qualifier]",
01056     "",
01057     "    timestamp:",
01058     "      YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.nanoseconds]",
01059     "",
01060     "Description",
01061     "-----------",
01062     "",
01063     "The DELETE command provides a way to delete cells from a row in a table.  The",
01064     "command applies to a single row only and can be used to delete, for a given",
01065     "row, all of the cells in a qualified column, all the cells in a column family,",
01066     "or all of the cells in the row.  If the TIMESTAMP clause is given, then the",
01067     "delete will only apply to those cells whose internal timestamp field is equal",
01068     "to or less than the given timestamp.  An example of each type of delete is",
01069     "shown below.  Assume that we're starting with a table that contains the",
01070     "following:",
01071     "",
01072     "  hypertable> SELECT * FROM crawldb;",
01073     "  org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
01074     "  org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
01075     "  org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
01076     "  org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
01077     "  org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.opensource.org/       Hypertable.org",
01078     "  org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.opensource.org/       Hypertable.org",
01079     "  org.hypertable.www      checksum        822828699",
01080     "  org.hypertable.www      checksum        2921728",
01081     "",
01082     "The first example shows how to delete the cells in the column",
01083     "anchor:http://www.opensource.org/ of the row \"org.hypertable.www\".",
01084     "",
01085     "  hypertable> DELETE \"anchor:http://www.opensource.org/\" FROM crawldb WHERE",
01086     "  ROW='org.hypertable.www';",
01087     "  ",
01088     "  hypertable> select * from crawldb;",
01089     "  org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
01090     "  org.hypertable.www      status-code     200",
01091     "  org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
01092     "  org.hypertable.www      anchor:http://www.news.com/     Hypertable",
01093     "  org.hypertable.www      checksum        822828699",
01094     "  org.hypertable.www      checksum        2921728",
01095     "",
01096     "The next example shows how to delete all of the cells in the column family",
01097     "checksum of the row \"org.hypertable.www\".",
01098     "",
01099     "  hypertable> DELETE checksum FROM crawldb WHERE ROW=\"org.hypertable.www\";",
01100     "",
01101     "  hypertable> select * from crawldb;",

01157   const char *help_text_shutdown[] = {
01158     "",
01159     "SHUTDOWN",
01160     "========",
01161     "",
01162     "    SHUTDOWN",
01163     "",
01164     "Description",
01165     "-----------",
01166     "",
01167     "The SHUTDOWN command gracefully shuts down the range servers by invoking the",
01168     "RangeServer::shutdown() command on each server.  The RangeServer::shutdown()",
01169     "command performs the following sequence of steps:",
01170     "",
01171     "  * close the RSML (range transaction log)",
01172     "  * close the ROOT commit log",
01173     "  * close the METADATA commit log",
01174     "  * close the USER commit log",
01175     "",
01176     "Hypertable must be shut down with this command when running on a filesystem",
01177     "such as HDFS 0.20 since it doesn't have a properly functioning fsync()",
01178     "operation.  Any other method of shutting down the range servers could result",
01179     "in loss of data, or worse, inconsistent or corrupt system state.",
01180     "",
01181     0
01182   };

01184 
01185   typedef hash_map<std::string, const char **>  HelpTextMap;
01186 
01187   HelpTextMap &build_help_text_map() {
01188     HelpTextMap *map = new HelpTextMap();
01189     (*map)[""] = help_text_contents;
01190     (*map)["contents"] = help_text_contents;
01191     (*map)["create table"] = help_text_create_table;
01192     (*map)["alter table"] = help_text_alter_table;
01193     (*map)["delete"] = help_text_delete;
01194     (*map)["insert"] = help_text_insert;
01195     (*map)["select"] = help_text_select;
01196     (*map)["describe table"] = help_text_describe_table;
01197     (*map)["describe"] = help_text_describe_table;
01198     (*map)["show create table"] = help_text_show_create_table;
01199     (*map)["show create"] = help_text_show_create_table;
01200     (*map)["load data infile"] = help_text_load_data_infile;
01201     (*map)["load data"] = help_text_load_data_infile;
01202     (*map)["load"] = help_text_load_data_infile;
01203     (*map)["show tables"] = help_text_show_tables;
01204     (*map)["drop"] = help_text_drop_table;
01205     (*map)["drop table"] = help_text_drop_table;
01206     (*map)["shutdown"] = help_text_shutdown;
01207     return *map;
01208   }
01209 
01210   HelpTextMap &text_map = build_help_text_map();
01211 }
01212 
01213 
01214 const char **HqlHelpText::get(const String &subject) {
01215   HelpTextMap::const_iterator iter = text_map.find(subject);
01216   if (iter == text_map.end())
01217     return 0;
01218   return (*iter).second;
01219 }
